At this point, I put the suggestion before the site admin that the forum post templates are edited so as to remove the join date field. The data would still be displayed on someone's profile, but a lack of it on each post might help salve over this new, arbitrary division in the community.

Of course, the down side of that is that it means post count becomes more important, which might encourage new people to spam in order to seem like they are an oldbie.

Personally, when I ran my own forums, I avoided any kinds of stats that can be construed as "forum experience points", such as post counts and join dates. It's fine to display these in profiles, but when they are a part of each post we make, people sometimes make a game of it and there is resentment when they cannot "win", particularly if there arbitrary events such as the forum reset which might "reset their XP."

If people want to share their join dates, what version of KSP they bought first, etc. then they could use their signature for that.

Then again, a forum reset doesn't bother me that much. I don't particularly care about my date or post count (or other people's, for that matter). Maybe it only bothers a handful of people here, and does not require the time needed for addressing the issue, and I am just over-analyzing the issue.

I've had great advice and fun by talking to oldbies and newbies alike on here.
